statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
The zoo have N cats and M dogs, today there are P children visiting the zoo, each child has a like-animal and a dislike-animal, if the child's like-animal is a cat, then his/hers dislike-animal must be a dog, and vice versa.
Now the zoo administrator is removing some animals, if one child's like-animal is not removed and his/hers dislike-animal is removed, he/she will be happy. So the administrator wants to know which animals he should remove to make maximum number of happy children.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The input file contains multiple test cases, for each case, the first line contains three integers N <= 100, M <= 100 and P <= 500.
Next P lines, each line contains a child's like-animal and dislike-animal, C for cat and D for dog. (See sample for details)

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each case, output a single integer: the maximum number of happy children.

statement.title: Sample Input
statement.content:
1 1 2
C1 D1
D1 C1

1 2 4
C1 D1
C1 D1
C1 D2
D2 C1

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
1
3


Hint
Case 2: Remove D1 and D2, that makes child 1, 2, 3 happy.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2011 Multi-University Training Contest 1 - Host by HNU
